pr_title: Enhance UX of Searchbar and make code simpler and more streamlined

timeline.message: Enhance UX of Searchbar and make code simpler and more streamlined
Fetch autocomplete values when autocomplete key is selected

replies.bodyText:
What did you use for alphabetizing?
VSCode extension?
replies.author: tacigar

replies.bodyText: Manual :) Eventually we can extend the eslint to do it automatically though, in other projects it's been automatic for me.
replies.author: anuraaga

timeline.bodyText: Instead of passing in history, location you should be able to call useHistory, useLocation in this hook
timeline.author: anuraaga
anuraaga

timeline.bodyText: I think we should also handle when the lookback is milliseconds, not short durations tring
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: Are we going to handle this one? I think lookback can be a millisecond value if the user specifies the environment variable for it.
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText:
Ah, I understand what you are saying!
You say we should allow users to specify lookback in milliseconds manually, right?
I agree with you.
What do you think of the following UI?
Users can specify millisecond manually.
replies.author: tacigar

timeline.message: Setup styled-component's ThemeProvider and type definition
Allow to set up a millisecond lookbacks
Use styled-components for CriterionBox and fix delete-button's style bug
Show spanName and remoteServiceName after serviceName is selected

timeline.bodyText:
I know tagQuery doesn't match the old rest api annotationQuery, but chatted with @tacigar and I think these days almost never someone would put an "annotation" in there.
anyone object to having the UI say tagQuery not annotationQuery? (the rest api is the same regardless as not important enough to change) @openzipkin/core
timeline.author: codefromthecrypt
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,215 @@
+/*
+ * Copyright 2015-2020 The OpenZipkin Authors
+ *
+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except
+ * in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at

+ * is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express
+ * or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under
+ * the License.
+ */
+
+/* eslint-disable react/prop-types */
+
+import { act, renderHook } from '@testing-library/react-hooks';
+import { createMemoryHistory } from 'history';
+import moment from 'moment';
+import React from 'react';
+import { Router } from 'react-router-dom';
+
+import DiscoverPageContent, {
+  buildApiQuery,
+  parseDuration,
+  useQueryParams,
+} from './DiscoverPageContent';
+import render from '../../test/util/render-with-default-settings';
+
+describe('useQueryParams', () => {
+  it('should extract criteria from query string', () => {
+    const history = createMemoryHistory();
+    const wrapper = ({ children }) => {
+      return <Router history={history}>{children}</Router>;
+    };
+
+    history.push({
+      pathname: '/zipkin/',
+      // serviceName: serviceA
+      // spanName: spanB
+      // remoteServiceName: remoteServiceNameC
+      // minDuration: 10us
+      // maxDuration: 100ms
+      // annotationQuery:
+      //   key1: value1
+      //   key2
+      //   key3: value3
+      search:
+        '?serviceName=serviceA&spanName=spanB&remoteServiceName=remoteServiceNameC&minDuration=10us&maxDuration=100ms&annotationQuery=key1%3Dvalue1+and+key2+and+key3%3Dvalue3&limit=10',
+    });
+
+    const { result } = renderHook(() => useQueryParams(['key3']), { wrapper });
+    expect(result.current.criteria).toEqual([
+      { key: 'serviceName', value: 'serviceA' },
+      { key: 'spanName', value: 'spanB' },
+      { key: 'remoteServiceName', value: 'remoteServiceNameC' },
+      { key: 'minDuration', value: '10us' },
+      { key: 'maxDuration', value: '100ms' },
+      // AnnotationQuery
+      { key: 'key3', value: 'value3' },
+      { key: 'tagQuery', value: 'key1=value1 and key2' },

timeline.message: Search traces when enter key is pressed
Fix key props bug of SearchBar

timeline.author: anuraaga
anuraaga

replies.bodyText:
If there is no setTimeout, LookbackMenu will also be closed when the DateTimePicker's dialog is clicked.

I use setTimeout to achieve the following behavior
replies.author: tacigar

timeline.bodyText: Looks like you can combine the ifs
timeline.author: anuraaga

timeline.bodyText: Can we use a more descriptive name than ss? Not sure what ss stands for here
timeline.author: anuraaga

timeline.bodyText: As far as I can tell this callback pattern has bad performance since the functions all get initialized every render. Instead of using the index factory can't you do something like useCallback((criterion) => criteria.find(c => c.id == criterion.id)?
timeline.author: anuraaga

timeline.message: Don't support milliseconds in custom lookback

timeline.bodyText: More specifically, we should have a test where this is set to an arbitrary milliseconds like 1234567
timeline.author: anuraaga

timeline.message: Support specifying a lookback in any millisecond
